task.title: Defining a Technical Service in an XML File

context.p: An XML file defining a technical service contains a description of the service's purpose, the license agreement, application parameters, options, events, service roles, and operations.

A service definition must conform to the TechnicalServices.xsd XML schema. The schema can be downloaded from https://github.com/servicecatalog/oscm/releases/. For detailed information on the elements and attributes, refer to .
To prepare a service definition in an XML file:

step.cmd: Create an XML file according to the TechnicalServices.xsd XML schema, and save it under a name of your choice, for example, ServiceDefinition.xml.
In the TechnicalService section of the file, specify at least the following information:

ul.li: provisioningType (if not specified, instance provisioning is performed in synchronous mode)
provisioningUrl (optional for external access, otherwise required)

choices.choice: If users log in directly to your application (user or direct access), describe how to access the application using the accessInfo element.
Fill in the baseUrl attribute (mandatory for login and external access).
If login is performed through (login access), fill in the loginPath attribute.

step.cmd: If there are any parameters that are to be passed to your application by an instance provisioning call, declare them in the ParameterDefinition sections.
If your application sends events to , declare all the events in the Event sections.
If you want to define your own service roles, declare them in the Role sections.
If you want to allow users to invoke specific operations on your technical service, declare the operations in the Operation sections.
